philosophy.origin: Started in 2018 filming Crystal’s synchro team
values: Make every skater look like a superstar
Privacy-focused: parents only see their own kids' albums

competition_registration_workflow.value: May 26, 2025: Sam's competition registration system: Netlify forms → Gmail notifications → auto-saved to Google Sheets. No need for Netlify MCP since data flows through Gmail. Future Gmail MCP could query registration emails directly: "How many Elite entries?" or "Who registered for multiple competitions?" Clean pipeline with one source of truth.

nova_spay_search_picture_hills_pricing.value: May 27, 2025: Sam seeking spay options for Nova (15lb teacup Mini Aussie). Picture Hills Pet Hospital quoted $1200 - "highway robbery." Pet Resource Center offers $80 all-inclusive but Sam wants middle ground: "Nova is not going under the knife at the Goodwill Vet." Researching NAWS (Northland Animal Welfare Society) as potential sweet spot - they specialize in spay/neuter with 25,000+ procedures completed. Sam doesn't qualify for low-income rates (GS-12 Step 3/4, ~$90-95k). Email sent to NAWS for standard pricing.

shootproof_api_access_manus.value: May 27, 2025: ShootProof API access available through Manus. OAuth 2.0 authentication with Bearer token. Base URL: https://api.shootproof.com/studio. Key endpoints: GET /brand/{brandId}/order (list all orders), GET /brand/{brandId}/order/{orderId} (order details). Order response includes: orderNumber, created timestamp, grandTotal, currencyCode, customerEmail, customerName. Token expires after 14 days. API uses hypermedia links for pagination. No explicit download_sent field, but can verify order details and customer email.

shootproof_api_filtering_capabilities.value: May 27, 2025: ShootProof API filtering capabilities per Manus. Date filtering likely supported via created_after/created_before parameters (needs testing). Status filtering possibly via status parameter. No documented endpoint for resending download emails - might exist as /order/{orderId}/resend-download or POST action (needs verification). Order fulfillment status fields not clearly documented in available code. Recommendation: test parameters, check full docs, or contact ShootProof support for these specific features.

shootproof_api_advanced_features.value: May 27, 2025: ShootProof API advanced features from Manus. Date filtering likely via created_after/created_before parameters (ISO 8601 format). Resend download emails might be POST to /order/{orderId}/resend-download or /order/{orderId}/actions with action:resend_download. Order fulfillment fields potentially include: status, fulfillmentStatus, downloadStatus, paymentStatus. All features need empirical testing as not explicitly documented. Recommendation: test API calls with these parameters to confirm functionality.

shootproof_mcp_feasibility_manus.value: May 27, 2025: Manus completed feasibility research for ShootProof MCP server. Delivered 3 documents: Summary Report, Feasibility Analysis, Architecture/Implementation Guide. Key findings: ShootProof API well-suited for MCP due to RESTful architecture, OAuth auth, JSON responses. Timeline: 2-3 weeks for minimal version, 4-6 weeks for full implementation. Would enable: checking order status/downloads, custom reports, identifying issues, automating customer communications. Manus confirms it's technically feasible and would provide significant value for photography workflow automation.

shootproof_mcp_implementation_guide_manu.value: May 27, 2025: Manus delivered complete ShootProof MCP implementation guide. Includes: Full Python code examples with authentication manager, API client, and MCP server structure. Key tools: searchOrders, getOrderDetails, checkDownloadStatus, resendDownload, matchOrdersToGalleries, generateOrderReport. Resource mapping for orders, galleries, contacts, price sheets, photos. Architecture shows OAuth handling, rate limiting, error handling. Timeline: 2-3 weeks for minimal version (read-only), 4-6 weeks for full version. Complete blueprint ready for CC or developer to implement.

senior_banner_workflow_2025.value: May 2025: Sam's senior banner photo workflow - clients review photos via Adobe Lightroom link, can pick ONE final banner photo (or give Sam a few options to choose from), unlimited regular photo selections for full editing. Sam created new review instructions page on website that Becky helped proofread (caught embarrassing typo). Current client: Janelle Yonker (05/18 shoot).
